intro: Dolichodeira, commonly known as the creeping bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their trailing growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. They typically have opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Dolichodeira species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. They are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
